Package algorithms.imageProcessing.transform

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
algorithms.imageProcessing.transform.Camera
public class Camera extends Object
utility methods for camera intrinsic and extrinsic matrices. KIntrinsic is the camera intrinsic parameters KExtrinsic is the camera extrinsic parameters, specifically, the camera position and orientation in world coordinates. to project the world coordinate system point into the camera frame canonical form, multiply it by the extrinsic matrix (which will translate the coordinates and rotate them). to project the camera frame coordinate system into the image frame, multiply it by the intrinsic matrix. TODO: consider implementing tangential distortion. see Heikkila, Janne, and Olli Silven 1997. "A four-step camera calibration procedure with implicit image correction." Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition, 1997. Proceedings., 1997 IEEE Computer Society Conference on. IEEE, 1997.
Author:
nichole

  • Method Details

    • createIntrinsicCameraMatrix

      public static double[][] createIntrinsicCameraMatrix(double focalLength, double centerX, double centerY)
      create camera intrinsic matrix k with assumptions of square pixels and no skew. the focal length and optical centers should be in units of pixels. NOTE that given the field of view (FOV) and the image dimensions, one can roughly estimate the focal length as (image width/2) / tan(FOV/2).
      Parameters:
      focalLength - focal length of camera in units of pixels. NOTE that the sign of the focal length remains the same as is given, so if you want to use a right-hand coordinate system, you should give a negative focal length.
      centerX - x coordinate of principal point in pixels, usually image center.
      centerY - y coordinate of principal point in pixels, usually image center.
      Returns:
      intrinsic camera matrix in units of pixels.

    • createIntrinsicCameraMatrix

      public static double[][] createIntrinsicCameraMatrix(double focalLengthX, double focalLengthY, double centerX, double centerY, double skew)
      create camera intrinsic matrix k. the focal length and optical centers should be in units of pixels. NOTE that given the field of view (FOV) and the image dimensions, one can roughly estimate the focal length as (image width/2) / tan(FOV/2).
      Parameters:
      focalLengthX - focal length of camera in units of pixels along x axis. NOTE that the sign of the focal length remains the same as is given, so if you want to use a right-hand coordinate system, you should give a negative focal length.
      focalLengthY - focal length of camera in units of pixels along y axis. NOTE that the sign of the focal length remains the same as is given, so if you want to use a right-hand coordinate system, you should give a negative focal length.
      centerX - x coordinate of principal point in pixels, usually image center.
      centerY - y coordinate of principal point in pixels, usually image center.
      skew - camera skew
      Returns:
      intrinsic camera matrix in units of pixels.

    • createIntrinsicCameraMatrixInverse

      public static double[][] createIntrinsicCameraMatrixInverse(double focalLength, double centerX, double centerY)
      create the inverse of camera intrinsic matrix k with assumptions of square pixels and no skew. the focal length and optical centers should be in units of pixels. NOTE that given the field of view (FOV) and the image dimensions, one can roughly estimate the focal length as (image width/2) / tan(FOV/2).
      Parameters:
      focalLength - focal length of camera in units of pixels. NOTE that the sign of the focal length remains the same as is given, so if you want to use a right-hand coordinate system, you should give a negative focal length.
      centerX - x coordinate of principal point in pixels, usually image center.
      centerY - y coordinate of principal point in pixels, usually image center.
      Returns:
      intrinsic camera matrix in units of pixels.

      Returns:

    • createCamera

      public static double[][] createCamera(double[][] k, double[][] r, double[] t)
      create the camera projection matrix as P = K * [R | t].
      Parameters:
      k - camera intrinsics matrix of size 3 x 3.
      r - camera extrinsic rotation matrix of size 3 x 3.
      t - camera extrinsic translation vector of length 3 in homogeneous coordinates (z-axis has value 1).
      Returns:
      the camera matrix resulting from intrinsic and extrinsic parameters. the size is 3 x 4.

    • createExtrinsicCameraMatrix

      public static double[][] createExtrinsicCameraMatrix(double[][] r, double[] t)
      create extrinsic camera matrix assuming the relation x = R * XW + t. the resulting matrix is [R | t]
      Parameters:
      r - camera extrinsic rotation matrix of size 3 x 3.
      t - camera extrinsic translation vector of length 3 in homogenous coordinates (the z-axis holds value 1).
      Returns:
      the extrinsic camera matrix. the size is 3 x 4.

    • createCameraInverse

      public static double[][] createCameraInverse(double[][] k, double[][] r, double[] t)
      TODO: revise and test. not ready for use. a quick rough method to estimate the 3D homogeneous point from the 2D-homogenous point and this inverse camera matrix, with caveat about missing information on the last dimension. One should use reconstruction methods instead of this method. to use: 
       double[][] X = MatrixUtil.multiply(cameraInv, x);
 then divide each column by the 3rd row.
      Parameters:
      k - camera intrinsics matrix of size 3 x 3.
      r - camera extrinsic rotation matrix of size 3 x 3.
      t - camera extrinsic translation vector of length 2.
      Returns:
      the inverse camera matrix resulting from intrinsic and extrinsic parameters. the size is 4x3

    • cameraToPixelCoordinates

      public static double[][] cameraToPixelCoordinates(double[][] xC, double[] rCoeffs, double focalLength, double centerX, double centerY, boolean useR2R4)
      applies radial distortion to distortion-free camera centered coordinates then multiplies by the camera intrinsics to result in distorted coordinates in the image reference frame in units of pixels. In terms of Table 1 of Ma et al. 2004, the input is a double array of (x, y) and the output is a double array of (u_d, v_d). The radial distortion functions to choose are from Ma et al. 2004 Table 2. The choices are model #4, f(r) = 1 +k1*r^2 + k2*r^4, or model #3, f(r) = 1 +k1*r + k2*r^2. Note that if rCoeffs is null or empty, no radial distortion is applied. Also useful reading is NVM Tools by Alex Locher https://github.com/alexlocher/nvmtools.git
      Parameters:
      xC - distortion-free camera centered coordinates. format is 3XN for N points. In terms of Table 1 of Ma et al. 2004, this is a double array of (x, y).
      rCoeffs - radial distortion vector of length 2 distortion vector of length 5. can be null to skip lens distortion correction. if
      focalLength - focal length of camera in units of pixels.
      centerX - x coordinate of principal point in pixels, usually image center.
      centerY - y coordinate of principal point in pixels, usually image center.
      useR2R4 - if true use radial distortion function from Ma et al. 2004 for model #4 in Table 2, f(r) = 1 +k1*r^2 + k2*r^4, else if false use model #3 f(r) = 1 +k1*r + k2*r^2. note that if rCoeffs is null or empty, no radial distortion is applied.
      Returns:
      pixels in the reference frame of image with distortion applied. In terms of Table 1 of Ma et al. 2004, this is a double array of (u_d, v_d)

      kIntr -

    • pixelToNormalizedCameraCoordinates

      public static double[][] pixelToNormalizedCameraCoordinates(double[][] x, Camera.CameraIntrinsicParameters intrinsic) throws no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException
      converts pixel coordinates to normalized camera coordinates by transforming them to camera reference frame then applying Lp2-normalization.
      Parameters:
      x - points in the image reference frame. format is 3XN for N points in row-major format.
      intrinsic -
      Returns:
      pixels transformed to camera coordinate reerence frame then Lp2-normalized.
      Throws:
      no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException

    • worldToCameraCoordinates

      public static double[][] worldToCameraCoordinates(double[][] xW, double[][] rot, double[] trans)
      transform the world coordinates xW to the camera reference frame using (rot * xW + trans).
      Parameters:
      xW - coordinates of objects in a world reference frame. The format is 3XN for N points.
      rot - the rotation matrix to apply to the translated coordinates. the size is 3X3.
      trans - the translation to apply to coordinates xW in x, y, and z. The length of the array is 3.
      Returns:
      xW transformed to the camera reference frame.

    • worldToCameraCoordinates

      public static double[] worldToCameraCoordinates(double[] xWPt, double[][] rot, double[] trans)
      transform the world coordinate point xWPt to the camera reference frame using (rot * xW + trans).
      Parameters:
      xWPt - coordinates of an object in a world reference frame. The length is 3.
      rot - the rotation matrix to apply to the translated coordinates. the size is 3X3.
      trans - the translation to apply to coordinates xW in x, y, and z. The length of the array is 3.
      Returns:
      the point xW transformed to the camera reference frame.

    • worldToCameraCoordinates

      public static void worldToCameraCoordinates(double[] xWPt, double[][] rot, double[] trans, double[] aux, double[] out)
      transform the world coordinate point xWPt to the camera reference frame using (rot * xW + trans).
      Parameters:
      xWPt - coordinates of an object in a world reference frame. The length is 3.
      rot - the rotation matrix to apply to the translated coordinates. the size is 3X3.
      trans - the translation to apply to coordinates xW in x, y, and z. The length of the array is 3.
      aux - an auxiliary array of length 3 used internally to hold values for a calculation. it's present to help the invoker reuse an object instead of creating another. it's values are not used.
      out - the point xW transformed to the camera reference frame.

    • worldToCameraCoordinates

      public static void worldToCameraCoordinates(double[] xWPt, double[][] rot, double[] trans, double[] out)
      transform the world coordinate point xWPt to the camera reference frame using (rot * xW + trans).
      Parameters:
      xWPt - coordinates of an object in a world reference frame. The length is 3.
      rot - the rotation matrix to apply to the translated coordinates. the size is 3X3.
      trans - the translation to apply to coordinates xW in x, y, and z. The length of the array is 3.
      out - the point transformed to the camera reference frame.

    • pixelToCameraCoordinates

      public static double[][] pixelToCameraCoordinates(double[][] x, Camera.CameraIntrinsicParameters kIntr) throws no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException, IOException
      converts pixel coordinates to camera coordinates by transforming them to camera reference frame then removing radial distortion. The input in terms of Table 1 of Ma et al. 2004 is a double array of (u_d, v_d) and the output is a double array of (x, y). Also useful reading is NVM Tools by Alex Locher https://github.com/alexlocher/nvmtools.git
      Parameters:
      x - points in the image reference frame. format is 3XN for N points.
      kIntr -
      Returns:
      pixels in the reference frame of
      Throws:
      no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException
      IOException

    • pixelToCameraCoordinates

      public static double[][] pixelToCameraCoordinates(double[][] x, double[][] intr, double[] rCoeffs, boolean useR2R4) throws no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException, IOException
      converts pixel coordinates to camera coordinates by transforming them to camera reference frame then removing radial distortion. The input in terms of Table 1 of Ma et al. 2004 is a double array of (u_d, v_d) and the output is a double array of (x, y). Also useful reading is NVM Tools by Alex Locher https://github.com/alexlocher/nvmtools.git
      Parameters:
      x - points in the image reference frame. format is 3XN for N points.
      intr - intrinsic camera parameters. dimensions aer [3 X 3]
      rCoeffs - radial distortion vector of length 2 or radial and tangential distortion vector of length 5. can be null to skip lens distortion correction.
      useR2R4 - use radial distortion function from Ma et al. 2004 for model #4 in Table 2, f(r) = 1 +k1*r^2 + k2*r^4 if true, else use model #3 f(r) = 1 +k1*r + k2*r^2. note that if rCoeffs is null or empty, no radial distortion is removed.
      Returns:
      pixels in the reference frame of
      Throws:
      no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException
      IOException

    • transformToUnitNormDirections

      public static double[][] transformToUnitNormDirections(double[][] x, Camera.CameraIntrinsicParameters k)
      transform 2D pixel measurements x_i to unit norm 3D directions 
       references Szeliski 2010, eqn (6.36)
      Parameters:
      x - 2D pixel measurements in format 3XN where the rows are x, y, and "1"'s and the columns are each point in the N points.
      k - camera intrinsic parameters
      Returns:
